member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.AddAudioTrack
member.summary: Writes the data stream to the current media as a new track.

param.name: data
param.para: An IStream interface of the audio data to write as the next track on the media.
The data format contains 44.1KHz, 16-bit stereo, raw audio samples. This is the same format used by the audio samples in a Microsoft WAV audio file (without the header).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

The requested operation is only valid when media has been "prepared".
Value: 0xC0AA0502

There is currently a write operation in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0500

CD-R and CD-RW media support a maximum of 99 audio tracks.
Value: 0xC0AA0508

The provided audio stream is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AA050D

There is not enough space left on the media to add the provided audio track.
Value: 0xC0AA0509

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The request was canceled.
Value: 0xC0AA0002

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.CancelAddTrack
member.summary: Cancels the current write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

There is no write operation currently in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0501

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_BufferUnderrunFreeDisabled
member.summary: Determines if Buffer Underrun Free recording is enabled.
member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if Buffer Underrun Free recording is disabled; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE (enabled).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_ClientName
member.summary: Retrieves the friendly name of the client.
member.param: Name supplied by the client application.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Value: 0x80004003

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.summary: Retrieves the type of media in the disc device.
member.param: Type of media in the disc device. For possible values, see the enumeration type.

listheader.description: Return code

The media is inserted upside down.

There is no media in the device.

Value: 0xC0AA0300

Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control is in use. Otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE to indicate that another rotational-speed control that the recorder supports is in use.

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_DoNotFinalizeMedia
member.summary: Determines if the media is left open for writing after writing the audio track.
member.param: Is VARIANT_TRUE if the media is left open for writing after writing the audio track; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_ExpectedTableOfContents
member.summary: Retrieves the table of content for the audio tracks that were laid on the media within the track-writing session.
member.param: Table of contents for the audio tracks that were laid on the media within the track-writing session. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of type VT_BYREF|VT_UI1. The pbVal member of the variant contains a binary blob. For details of the blob, see the READ TOC command at ftp://ftp.t10.org/t10/drafts/mmc5/mmc5r03.pdf.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

A write operation is in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0500

The media is not prepared (IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.PrepareMedia has not been called).
Value: 0xC0AA0502

The media is blank.
Value: 0xC0AA0505

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_FreeSectorsOnMedia
member.summary: Retrieves the number of sectors available for adding a new track to the media.
member.param: Number of available sectors on the media that can be used for writing audio.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

The media is not prepared (IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.PrepareMedia has not been called).
Value: 0xC0AA0502

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_NumberOfExistingTracks
member.summary: Retrieves the number of existing audio tracks on the media.
member.param: Number of completed tracks written to disc, not including the track currently being added.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

The media is not prepared (IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.PrepareMedia has not been called).
Value: 0xC0AA0502

A write operation is in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0500

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_Recorder
member.summary: Retrieves the recording device to use for the write operation.
member.param: An interface that identifies the recording device to use in the write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_RequestedRotationTypeIsPureCAV
member.summary: Retrieves the requested rotational-speed control type.
member.param: Requested rotational-speed control type. Is VARIANT_TRUE for constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control type. Otherwise, is VARIANT_FALSE for any other rotational-speed control type that the recorder supports.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_RequestedWriteSpeed
member.summary: Retrieves the requested write speed.

param.name: value
param.para: Requested write speed measured in disc sectors per second.
A value of 0xFFFFFFFF (-1) requests that the write occurs using the fastest supported speed for the media.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_SupportedWriteSpeedDescriptors
member.summary: Retrieves a list of the detailed write configurations supported by the disc recorder and current media.
member.param: List of the detailed write configurations supported by the disc recorder and current media. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of type VT_Dispatch. Query the pdispVal member of the variant for the interface, which contains the media type, write speed, rotational-speed control type.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

You cannot prepare the media until you choose a recorder to use.
Value: 0xC0AA050A

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.

Failed to allocate the required memory.

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The write failed because the drive returned error information that could not be recovered from.
Value: 0xC0AA0301

member.summary: Retrieves a list of the write speeds supported by the disc recorder and current media.
member.param: List of the write speeds supported by the disc recorder and current media. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of type VT_UI4. The ulVal member of the variant contains the number of sectors written per second.

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_TotalSectorsOnMedia
member.summary: Retrieves the total sectors available on the media if writing one continuous audio track.
member.param: Number of all sectors on the media that can be used for audio if one continuous audio track was recorded.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

The media is not prepared (IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.PrepareMedia has not been called).
Value: 0xC0AA0502

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.get_UsedSectorsOnMedia
member.summary: Retrieves the total number of used sectors on the media.
member.param: Number of used sectors on the media, including audio tracks and overhead that exists between tracks.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

Description

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

The media is not prepared (IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.PrepareMedia has not been called).

You cannot prepare the media until you choose a recorder to use.

Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.

Only blank CD-R/RW media is supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0506

The client name is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AA050F

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.put_BufferUnderrunFreeDisabled
member.summary: Determines if Buffer Underrun Free Recording is enabled.
member.param: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to disable Buffer Underrun Free Recording; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE (enabled).

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The media is not prepared (IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.PrepareMedia has not been called).
Value: 0xC0AA0502

A write operation is in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0500

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.put_ClientName
member.summary: Sets the friendly name of the client.
member.param: Name of the client application.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The client name is not valid.
Value: 0xC0AA050F

A write operation is in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0500

The requested operation is not valid when media has been "prepared" but not released.
Value: 0xC0AA0503

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.put_DoNotFinalizeMedia
member.summary: Determines if the media is left open for writing after writing the audio track.
member.param: Set to VARIANT_TRUE to leave the media open for writing after writing the audio track; otherwise, VARIANT_FALSE. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

A write operation is in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0500

The requested operation is not valid when media has been "prepared" but not released.
Value: 0xC0AA0503

The property cannot be changed once the media has been written to.
Value: 0xC0AA0504

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.put_Recorder
member.summary: Sets the recording device to use for the write operation.
member.param: An interface that identifies the recording device to use in the write operation.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

A write operation is in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0500

The requested operation is not valid when media has been "prepared" but not released.
Value: 0xC0AA0503

This device does not support the operations required by this disc format.
Value: 0xC0AA050E

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.ReleaseMedia
member.summary: Closes the track-writing session and releases the lock.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

A write operation is in progress.
Value: 0xC0AA0500

The requested operation is not valid when media has been "prepared" but not released.
Value: 0xC0AA0503

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

member.name: IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce.SetWriteSpeed
member.summary: Sets the write speed of the disc recorder.

param.name: RequestedSectorsPerSecond
param.para: Requested write speed measured in disc sectors per second.
A value of 0xFFFFFFFF (-1) requests that the write occurs using the fastest supported speed for the media. This is the default.

member.param: Requested rotational-speed control type. Set to VARIANT_TRUE to request constant angular velocity (CAV) rotational-speed control type. Set to VARIANT_FALSE to use another rotational-speed control type that the recorder supports. The default is VARIANT_FALSE.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description: Return code
Description

The request requires a current disc recorder to be selected.
Value: 0xC0AA0003

One or more arguments are not valid.
Value: 0x80070057

Pointer is not valid.
Value: 0x80004003

Unspecified failure.
Value: 0x80004005

Failed to allocate the required memory.
Value: 0x8007000E

The device failed to accept the command within the timeout period. This may be caused by the device having entered an inconsistent state, or the timeout value for the command may need to be increased.
Value: 0xC0AA020D

The device reported unexpected or invalid data for a command.
Value: 0xC0AA02FF

The media is inserted upside down.
Value: 0xC0AA0204

The drive reported that it is in the process of becoming ready. Please try the request again later.
Value: 0xC0AA0205

There is no media in the device.
Value: 0xC0AA0202

The media is currently being formatted. Please wait for the format to complete before attempting to use the media.
Value: 0xC0AA0206

The drive reported that it is performing a long-running operation, such as finishing a write. The drive may be unusable for a long period of time.
Value: 0xC0AA0207

The write failed because the drive did not receive data quickly enough to continue writing. Moving the source data to the local computer, reducing the write speed, or enabling a "buffer underrun free" setting may resolve this issue.
Value: 0xC0AA0300

The media is not compatible or of unknown physical format.
Value: 0xC0AA0203

The DVD structure is not present. This may be caused by incompatible drive/medium used.
Value: 0xC0AA020E

The device reported that the requested mode page (and type) is not present.
Value: 0xC0AA0201

The drive reported that the combination of parameters provided in the mode page for a MODE SELECT command were not supported.
Value: 0xC0AA0208

The drive reported that the media is write protected.
Value: 0xC0AA0209

The media's speed is incompatible with the device. This may be caused by using higher or lower speed media than the range of speeds supported by the device.
Value: 0xC0AA020F

The specified handle is invalid.
Value: 6

The specified network resource or device is no longer available.
Value: 55

The device associated with this recorder during the last operation has been exclusively locked, causing this operation to failed.
Value: 0xC0AA0210

The write failed because the drive returned error information that could not be recovered from.
Value: 0xC0AA0301

The requested rotation type was not supported by the drive and the rotation type was adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0005

The requested write speed was not supported by the drive and the speed was adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0004

The requested write speed and rotation type were not supported by the drive and they were both adjusted.
Value: 0x00AA0006

summary.para: Use this interface to write audio to blank CD-R or CD-RW media in Track-At-Once mode.

To create an instance of this interface, call the CoCreateInstance function. Use__uuidof(MsftDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce) for the class identifier and __uuidof(IDiscFormat2TrackAtOnce) for the interface identifier.
